intro: Acmadenia laxa, commonly known as the slender acmadenia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pinkish flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as heathlands and sandplains. Acmadenia laxa is often found in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia.
